body:
My #1 early stage founder tip: 

Your startup is dead by default (to people who have millions of things going in their lives) 

It is your job daily to resurrect it & make it worth remembering by telling stories, building in public, offering value etc

Want more startup tips? Give @Stonks_dot_com a follow.

We share actionable startup advice like this weekly

10 quick startup tips for founders...

1. Focus on culture
2. Set a clear vision
3. Talk to customers daily
4. Speed of execution wins
5. Make work fun
6. Truly care for your team
7. Own every mistake
8. Lead by example
9. Play the long game
10. Tres commas

What else?

Pro tip: When you ask to connect on Linkedin because you want to learn more about what that person is doing thats great. If the first message after they accept is a pitch deck and ask to fund your startup that just is not cool. Be upfront #startup #entrepreneurship

BIZ TIP OF THE DAY: 
As a startup, you can't win by copying the leader in your industry. You win by concentrating your efforts on your strengths.

Every startup must invest in copywriting.

Write great marketing copy and you can raise $50M in funding.

Here are copywriting tips from 7 fast-growing Saas startups in 2021

To sharpen your landing page copy 👇

celebrity endorsement campaigns are the fastest way to burn money. 

Highly recommended if you just raised a series and don't know what to do with it. 

Startup Marketing tip.
@dagorenouf @agazdecki Any tips for someone passionate about software / startups and clueless in marketing.

Startup tip:

Stop focusing on competition. 

Start focusing on being the most valuable product on the market.

We've raised $450k / $760k for @creable_io's Seed round. Now looking to allocate ~$300k to strategic US early stage startup investors or Superangels. Any tips who the best #creatoreconomy investors are?

As a startup founder, I used to chase advice from successful founders to not repeat the same mistakes

All I ended up with was a bunch of conflicting tips on what to do and how to do it ...

... which is not actionable

Now I'm trying it all by myself and seeing what works for me

My pitch to @Uber driver every morning:

- It is a cash trip
- There is added tip
- ESOPs in my startup 
- Will make warm intro to my investors
- Pro bono tech advisory

Driver says "Ok, I am coming" reluctantly and cancels the trip after 10 seconds 😑

@peakbengaluru
Joining @BukuWarung as a software engineer today, any tips? #tech #SoftwareEngineer #startup

Hot tip to PMs at startups 🌶 

Want to invest in *one* act that will have an outsized impact in your career — whether you work at a tiny bootstrapped startup or a sexy VC-backed rocketship? 

Learn no-code & build a portfolio of small apps 

You’ll be 10x more impactful at work

after theranos, the biggest scam of the startup industry will be one/most/all of what elon musk is doing. if you can't figure out the sociopathic behavior and the underlying issues behind the tip of the iceberg, you'll be shocked at how it all collapsed for elizabeth holmes.

Dear Twitter algorithm,

I can't/won't tweet every day about startup ideas or marketing tips to get followers.

Yours Sincerely,
Miss Sorted

The google drive update is disdainfully awful.

I don't like the folder icons as much, the change is effectively does nothing, but now it gives me notifications on startup of "helpful tips and tricks uwu" that I CANNOT DISABLE

I've had a couple of founders tell me that they'd love to work with a coach but can't fit it into the startup's budget.

Founders who DO work with a coach: any tips for how to navigate this? Are there coaches out there who would help in exchange for a small amount of equity? 🤔

I have an interview coming up with the engineering team at a ~100 person startup. Position is Junior Front-end Software Eng. Don't think it is a technical challenge

Any tips to impress them? How should I prepare?

To those of you who are solo founders, of startups or VC firms, how did you manage parental leave?

How long did you take off? Assume not fully off work though, right?

(yes, BIG life update!👶)

Would love to hear thoughts, suggestions, tips and advice!
some personal news: today is my first day as a staff reporter at @Inc! very excited to be covering startups, entrepreneurs, and the workplace—to send any tips, pls email me rdeczynski@inc.com!
@agazdecki What are your tips for a non-tech background individual getting started with startups at 21

At our founder roundtable this week, I got lots of questions about how a pre-revenue company should project financials. 

A VC backable startup should be able to achieve $25M revenue in 5 years, at a minimum.

See quick 🧵 for more tips:
If you’re a VP of sales at a startup and haven’t done a walking selfie video on LinkedIn with some helpful tip, are you really doing your job?
Hi all, a bit of a personal news - I've joined @DealStreetAsia as a correspondent. Please don't hesitate to drop me any tip on Indonesia PE, VC, M&A, and startups. Love to hear 'em!

It’s that time again! Welcome to today’s episode of #NCBAMoneyMastery where we’ll be focusing on ‘Entrepreneurship tips for startups’. 
We are joined by Centonomy’s Head of Learning and Innovation Sheba Njagi. 
#NCBAMoneyMastery 
#NumbersThatMatter

If you're building a startup make it fun and enjoy the process. Here's some tips...

1. Accept things won't go as planned
2. Don't compare yourself to others
3. Celebrate every win
4. Write down goals
5. Tune out the noise
6. Constantly learning
7. Laugh daily
8. Just execute

startup advice for founders 🚀 

1) build
2) sell
3) hire
3) grow
5) exit

 reply with your top startup tips 👇
